name: Esther Robinsun-Abrams
skills: Building Relationships While Working from Home
Project Management: Choosing the Right Online Tool
education: University of California, Los Angeles - Bachelor of Arts (BA) in World Arts and Culture, Music Industry (2014 - 2018)

experience.description: Consulting & experiential production for clients including: Spotify, Netflix, BuzzFeed, Under Armour, LVMH, MetaMask, Warner, NFT.NYC, ETHDenver, Avalanche, Nike and more.

experience.position: Program Manager, We The Culture & Dale Tú

experience.description: Expanded cultural reach to new markets through events, targeted outreach, and digital marketing content. Managed artist partnerships with Kehlani, Cuco, Kenny Beats, Rico Nasty, Young Kio + more. Organized events including The Hundreds Family Style Food Festival (Los Angeles), Us Kids Sundance Premiere Party (Park City), Babes Only All Star Weekend Brunch (Chicago), Rexx Life Raj Album Release Party (Oakland).
Created and executed production strategies for Tony Hsieh's latest innovative arts and culture venture in Park City, UT.
Coordinated and implemented creative marketing strategies; managed freelance teams; generated and managed end-to-end client relations including Disney, TikTok, Amazon Studios, Beats By Dre + more.

Created action points and collected resources for WeTransfer’s IntoAction, achieving a click-through rate of 2.7% and 34K downloads in 2 weeks. Served as PR to secure partners for WeTransfer’s Against Gun Violence project to showcase how creatives illustrate America’s gun violence issue.
Booked and interviewed guests with co-host Theo Martins, including Kari Faux, IDK, Jay Prince, starRo and more.

experience.position: Hip Hop Genre Coordinator and Resident DJ / Radio Host
experience.description: Booked and interviewed guests including Snoh Aalegra, Andre Power (Soulection), Duckwrth and many more.

bio: Experienced creative event and marketing manager with a demonstrated history of working across entertainment industries. Passionate, detail-oriented and organized people person with a World Arts and Cultures BA from University of California, Los Angeles.
